page.title: 16BLACKMORE VALE DAIRY FARMING
page.content: Three dairy farms occupy the whole of 0375/0115 which has excellent pasture- land.They all have milking parlours and modern machinery.The milk from the Friesian herds goes to the Milk Market Board depot.Grass silage and hay are made.No arable crops are grown.Local stone was used for the farm buildings erected on the higher land above the flood levels of the River Lydden which crosses this area in two places. Only 12 people live in this area, mostly agricultural workers.All the farms are a distance from the nearest road but there is a weekly bus service between Yeovil and Blandford Forum and another weekly service to Sturminster. There are many public footpaths with footbridges over the river but they are little used now and hard to trace. This area,ideal for wildlife,has only common birds,butterflies and flies.
